translated: Ödlund, Eva Maria, Miss, Linköping, b. 5/11/92 in Njurunda, Väster-norrland. 1st child of district fiscal O. P. Ö. and Hilma Schöblom. Graduate of Härnösand girls' school. Textile certificate from Handarbetets Vänner in Stockholm in 1911, and handiwork teaching certificate from Handarbetets Vänner and Hulda Lundin's handicraft seminar in Stockholm in 1915. Received textile study scholarship from the Swedish Craft Association for studies in England and France in 1921, and textile study scholarships from the Swedish Craft Association for studies in Germany, Czechoslovakia, and Italy in 1929. Received Lars Hierta's memorial scholarship for studies in Belgium, Germany, and Denmark in 1935, and conducted research in Norway and Finland. Employed as instructor for weaving and sewing courses in Bohuslän by Gothenburg Handicraft Association and Bohuslän Handicraft Association from 1914-1917. Director of Östergötland's Home Craft Association from 1917. Chairwoman of Linköping's Housewives Association from 1942-1946. Chairwoman of Östergötland's Housewives Association and member of the central board of the Swedish Housewives Association. Member of the executive board of the Swedish Home Craft Association and the Home Craft Association. Chairwoman of the Home Craft Ring. Published "Vävbok" (Weaving Book) in 1938. Awarded the silver plaque by the Swedish Home Craft Association in 1942. Recipient of FMM for humanitarian efforts.
